Starters.name: Burrata di Moderna
Starters.desc: A delicate sphere of burrata presented on a bed of rocket and fresh garden tomatoes, with whispers of balsamic and olive oil. Pairs exquisitely with existential contemplation.

Starters.name: Garlic Bread of the Gods
Starters.desc: Bread (sometimes homemade) is criss cross cut, and loaded with our homemade roasted garlic herb butter and cheese. Pairs delightfully with marinara, but is also delicious on its own!

Starters.name: Curried Brussels Sprouts
Starters.desc: Brussels sprouts find themselves seasoned with curry and pan roasted to a tender perfection, served with a meticulously crafted tzatziki sauce for a truly restoring balance.

Starters.name: Hummus with Pita
Starters.desc: A homemade creamy hummus is married with a homemade whole wheat pita bread. Is this a starter or a light lunch? That's for you to decide.

Pasta.name: Lasagna
Pasta.desc: Layers of pasta, sauce, and cheese that never quite settle into a predictable pattern. Each forkful traces a unique path through a delicious, yet ever-evolving, culinary space

Pasta.name: Pango's Pesto Pasta
Pasta.desc: A dazzling peso full of ingredients that remain a closely guarded secrete, much like the recipe for happiness. Accompanied by a side of ’what-ifs’ and a drizzle of self-doubt reduction.

Pasta.name: Russian Tofu Cutlets
Pasta.desc: Hand crafted paparadelle is the bedrock of this dish that includes a creamy vodka sauce, complete with a touch of heat, and tofu cutlets that have been breaded and lightly fried to a golden brown.

Pasta.name: Spaghetti and Meatlessballs
Pasta.desc: Almost placed in the American dishes, it was saved by the homemade spaghetti that we make for this dish. Along with our protein packed special meatlessballs.

Pasta.name: Bolognese de Tofu
Pasta.desc: A should be staple sometimes known as ragu, this dish involves topping homemade paparadelle with a slow cooked tomato sauce with ground tofu. This sauce has a rich complex flavor that you are sure to enjoy!

Pasta.name: Pasta Prima Vera
Pasta.desc: Hand crafted spaghetti finds itself tossed in a garden of sauteed seasonal veggies, doused with a light citrus wine sauce. Each bite is an invitation to ponder the transient nature of existence and the beauty of natural potential.

Pasta.name: Pasta Carbonara
Pasta.desc: Sweet, salty and smokey tofu compliments a rich egg sauce with parmesan reggiano and black pepper.

Pasta.name: Fettuccini Alfredo
Pasta.desc: One of the best dishes every made. Fettucini finds itself tossed in a garlic cream sauce.

Pasta.name: Sweet Potato Gnocchi
Pasta.desc: A sweet potato gnocchin is cloaked in a truffle rosemary cream sauce, a rich pairing that's often complimented with roasted veggies.

Pasta.name: Pasta al Scottie
Pasta.desc: A supremely simple dish of spaghetti tossed with parmesiano reggiano, pecorino romano, and olive oil. A simpleton as it were, the young lad never shied away from pasta and cheeses.

'Za.name: Classic Pan Pizza
'Za.desc: The first major success with a near baking experience, this pan pizza has a delightful and crispy crust, rich tomato sauce to compliement, a melty 5 cheese blend to finish, of course!

'Za.name: White Man in Brussels
'Za.desc: A white sauce forms the foundation of this pizza that includes an asiago blend, roasted brussels sprouts, broccoli, and kale. Finished with a balsamic glaze drizzle.

'Za.name: Pepperoni Pizza
'Za.desc: The only thing with meat that you will find in this menu, just the classic college experience of red sauce, cheese, and pepperoni (though we think this one is a bit elevated).

'Za.name: A Rick's Favorite Calzone
'Za.desc: Some would say a lost art, this different take on pizza altogether is available with your favorite selection of toppings.

Taste the World.name: Stir Fry
Taste the World.desc: A homemade stir fry sauce envelopes noodles, veggies, and Chinese 5 spice tofu, providing notes of salty and spice amid a subtle sweetness. It's not quite teriyaki, what is it? Not even we can say.

Taste the World.name: Paneer Tiki Masala
Taste the World.desc: Served with jeera rice and homemade naan. One of the few Indian dishes that we know how to make, so please go easy on us.

Taste the World.name: Aloo Gobi
Taste the World.desc: The classic cauliflower and potato side dish from India. We learned this to compliment our paneer dishes, and boy was it worth it!

Taste the World.name: Fried Rice
Taste the World.desc: Dealer's choice of: classic, pineapple, mango, or curried versions.

Taste the World.name: Thai Yellow Curry
Taste the World.desc: One of the first dishes I sought to make at a high level.

Taste the World.name: Sushi
Taste the World.desc: Delicately handcrafted sushi rolls with tofu, cucumber, carrots, jalapenos, avocado, and sriracha mayo. Also have an avocado roll, or a spicy avocado roll.

Taste of America (the good kind).name: Chipotle Bowls
Taste of America (the good kind).desc: Yeah, we aren't pretending this is Mexican, like some lamestream restaurants. Honey cholula tofu sits atop cilantro lime rice, completed with roasted veggies, salsa, cheese, yogurt, and a homemade guac!

Taste of America (the good kind).name: Tofu Breakfast Wraps
Taste of America (the good kind).desc: Tofu made to immitate egg paired with breakfast potatoes, cheese, and a spicy sauce. Avocado avilable upon request.

Taste of America (the good kind).name: Tofu Tacos
Taste of America (the good kind).desc: A taco version of the chipotle bowls (without rice, of course).

Taste of America (the good kind).name: Philly Cheese''steak''
Taste of America (the good kind).desc: A vegetarian take on the most valuable thing to come out of Philly. Made with freshly baked bread!

Taste of America (the good kind).name: Meatlessball Subs
Taste of America (the good kind).desc: A modern tragedy in the eyes of some, but a staple that powered me through an undergrad degree. Made with freshly baked bread!

Taste of America (the good kind).name: Mac and Cheese
Taste of America (the good kind).desc: A delightful homemade take on the dish that so many of us grew up on. Hopefully this one avoids bringing up any childhood trauma.

Chef's Special Menu.name: Tofu Deli Style Sandwich
Chef's Special Menu.desc: They said it couldn't be done, yet I did it. The trick? Shaved tofu, uncooked and seasoned makes the base of this sandwich with balsamic glaze, tomatoes, mozzarella, and cucumber. As odd as it sounds, it's worth trying once!

Chef's Special Menu.name: Fried Tofu Sandwich
Chef's Special Menu.desc: Emboldened by the deli sandwhich, we sought a unique experience of fried tofu with umami from a simple Asian style sauce, and slap this between two slices of homemade bread. If you didn't like the first rendition, this one is better (but who are we to judge?).

Chef's Special Menu.name: Buffalo Tofu Sliders
Chef's Special Menu.desc: The third entry in our tofu sandwich series, is curated from our Buffalo tofu, cheddar cheese, cucumbers, and vegan mayo. It may not be chicken, but it's pretty damn delicious!

Coming Soon....name: Ragu Bianco
Coming Soon....desc: White take of the classic Bolognese above.

Coming Soon....name: Mapo Tofu
Coming Soon....desc: Coming soon, our (vegetarian) take on a famous Chinese dish.

Coming Soon....name: Buffalo Mac and Cheese
Coming Soon....desc: Tofu prepared with the classic flavors of Buffalo sauce, find themselves atop a delightful mac and cheese.
